articles.title: Ian Joo
articles.contents: Welcome to my website. I’m Ian from South Korea, currently a PhD student at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University doing research on linguistic typology.

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Peer-reviewed journal articles



Joo, I. (2021). “The etymology of Korean ssal ‘uncooked grain’ and pap ‘cooked grain’”. In: Cahiers de linguistique Asie orientale 50.1. Download, pp. 94–110. DOI: 10.1163/19606028-bja10013.


Joo, I. and M. Liu (2021). “Caused-Motion and Caused-Position: Syntactic Patterns and Semantic Networks”. In: Studies in Language 45.2. Download, pp. 470–498. DOI: 10.1075/sl.18067.joo.


Joo, I. (2020). “Phonosemantic Biases Found in Leipzig-Jakarta Lists of 66 Languages”. In: Linguistic Typology 24.1. Download, pp. 1–12. DOI: 10.1515/lingty-2019-0030.



Book chapters



Koo, J. and I. Joo (2022). “Japanese-Korean Brush-talk during the Early Edo Period, 1603–1867”. In: Brush Conversation in the Sinographic Cosmopolis: Interactional Cross-border Communication Using Literary Sinitic in Early Modern East Asia. Ed. by D. C. S. Li, R. Aoyama and T. Wong. 1st ed. Routledge Studies in the Early History of Asia. London; New York: Routledge.
